title: Bounded Cohomology & Commutator Length
description: This course will discuss continuous dynamics on 3-manifolds from a geometric viewpoint. We are most interested in quasigeodesic and pseudo-Anosov flows, where a surprising amount of information about 3-dimensional continuous dynamics is captured by the âuniversal circle,â a 1-dimensional discrete dynamical system lying at infinity. The end goal is to present a conjectural picture of how the dynamics on the universal circle (up to conjugacy) determines the dynamics of the flow (up to semiconjugacy). We will review the basics of 3-manifold topology and hyperbolic geometry in the first few weeks, so the prerequisites are minimal. Math 544a and some familiarity with smooth manifolds and Riemannian geometry will suffice. A tentative outline, including possible topics, follow: I: 3-manifolds and geometry Building 3-manifolds - Dehn surgery, handlebody decompositions, branched coverings Geometric 3-manifolds Hyperbolic geometry II: Flows Examples of Flows Surgeries on orbits, Schweitzerâs plugs and Kuperberg flows III: Foliations IV: Quasigeodesic and pseudo-Anosov flows Sources: Danny Calegari, âFoliations and the Geometry of 3-Manifoldsâ. Sergio Fenley and Lee Mosher, âQuasigeodesic flows in hyperbolic 3-manifoldsâ. Steven Frankel, âQuasigeodesic flows and the sphere-filling curvesâ. Etienne Ghys, âGroups acting on the circleâ.
